revision.text: {{also|Yǎsī}} ==Apatani== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|apt|sit-tan-pro|*si||water}}, from {{inh|apt|sit-pro|*si||water}}. Cognate with {{cog|adi|asi}}, {{cog|sit-bok|iɕi}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|apt|[ˈjasi]}} ===Noun=== {{head|apt|noun}} # [[water]] ===References=== * Ivan Martin Simon, ''An introduction to Apatani'' (1973), page 191 * Tasso Sai, ''A Guide to Apatani Language'' (1983), page 11: "Air — alyi | Rain — ni'do | Water — yasi | Fire — yamu | Fire wood — yasang | Lightning — dolya | Thunder — yapung | Stone — yalang" * P. T. Abraham, ''Apatani grammar'' (1985), page 35 * Tianshin Jackson Sun, ''A Historical-Comparative Study of the Tani (Mirish) Branch in Tibeto-Burman'': Apatani S ''ja-si'' ---- ==Sekar== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|skz|poz-cet-pro|*asu}}, from {{inh|skz|poz-pro|*asu}}, from {{inh|skz|map-pro|*(w)asu}}. ===Noun=== {{head|skz|noun}} # [[dog]] {{gloss|animal}} [[Category:skz:Dogs]]
